title: Default Windows 7  32 Bit Fonts
description:
Default Windows 7 (32 Bit) Fonts :
=================================


Why upload Windows 7 default fonts ?


Have you ever faced the problem of your Windows / Office / Browser Fonts change to 

gaudy thick slanted fonts or something similar ? No matter what you do, you cannot 

get rid of this annoying & irritating syndrome.



This can happen for a number of reasons eg. Virus, Installing a software that 

changes the default fonts, Corrupted Fonts etc.

The default Fonts are either replaced, corrupted or damaged.

There is no ready solution to this problem either with Microsoft or with the 

effected browsers Websites. The solutions offered are meaningless or vague. They 

do not solve the problem.


The only sure shot solution is to :

Go to Start - Control Panel - Fonts Folder - Open Fonts Folder (as Administrator, 

if necessary) - Copy / Paste / Replace with Default System Fonts. Restart Windows.



The Damaged / Corrupted Fonts will be replaced and all your Fonts will be reset 

with default.



I had a similar problem long ago in Win XP, when I stumbled upon this method in a 

Blog on the Net. Since then, I always Backup my Fonts after a fresh install of 

Windows. This saved my butt a few days ago when my Fonts on Windows 7 went wonky. 

I don't remember which blog it was, but Thank the Blogger once again for this 

useful and life saving Tip.


(If an installed software created this problem, be sure to uninstall it before 

following the procedure above).



Thought I would share with you so that somewhere, sometime this may come in handy 

to someone.
